pinyin: Xué ér bù sī zé wǎng, sī ér bù xué zé dài.
english: Learning without thinking is useless; thinking without learning is dangerous.
meaning: Balance of study and reflection leads to wisdom.
author: Confucius

pinyin: Yán bì xìn, xíng bì guǒ.
english: One’s word must be trustworthy, one’s actions resolute.
meaning: Keep promises and follow through with determination.
author: Confucius

pinyin: Bù jīng yī shì, bù zhǎng yī zhì.
english: Without experiencing an event, one cannot gain wisdom.
meaning: Personal growth comes from facing challenges.
author: Anonymous

pinyin: Shí nián shù mù, bǎi nián shù rén.
english: It takes ten years to grow trees, but a hundred years to nurture people.
meaning: Education and cultivating talent take time and patience.
author: Anonymous

pinyin: Dà zhì ruò yú.
english: Great wisdom often appears foolish.
meaning: Truly wise people may seem simple or naive.
author: Laozi

pinyin: Yù bù zhuó, bù chéng qì.
english: Jade requires carving to become a gem.
meaning: Education and discipline shape a person’s character.
author: Anonymous

chinese: 吃得苦中苦，方为人上人。
pinyin: Chī dé kǔ zhōng kǔ, fāng wéi rén shàng rén.
english: Enduring the hardest hardships makes one stand above others.
meaning: Success requires enduring struggles.
author: Anonymous

pinyin: Jiàn yì yǒng wéi.
english: See what is right and act with courage.
meaning: A righteous person dares to act bravely for justice.
author: Confucius

pinyin: Dī shuǐ zhī ēn, dāng yǒng quán xiāng bào.
english: A drop of kindness should be repaid with a fountain of gratitude.
meaning: Be deeply grateful and repay kindness generously.
author: Anonymous

pinyin: Xíng bǎi lǐ zhě bàn jiǔ shí.
english: Ninety miles is only half of a hundred-mile journey.
meaning: The last stretch of a task is often the hardest.
author: Han Feizi

chinese: 授人以鱼不如授人以渔。
pinyin: Shòu rén yǐ yú bù rú shòu rén yǐ yú.
english: Giving a man a fish is not as good as teaching him to fish.
meaning: Teaching skills is better than giving temporary help.
author: Confucius

pinyin: Liáng qín zé mù ér qī.
english: A fine bird chooses the right tree to rest on.
meaning: Wise people choose worthy leaders to follow.
author: Anonymous

pinyin: Zhī zú cháng lè.
english: Contentment brings constant happiness.
meaning: Being satisfied with what you have leads to joy.
author: Laozi

pinyin: Shān bù zài gāo, yǒu xiān zé míng.
english: A mountain’s fame comes not from its height, but from the immortals who dwell there.
meaning: Value lies in people, not appearances.
author: Liu Yuxi

pinyin: Bù pà màn, jiù pà zhàn.
english: Don’t fear going slowly; fear only standing still.
meaning: Progress, no matter how slow, is better than stagnation.
author: Anonymous

pinyin: Tiān dào chóu qín.
english: Heaven rewards the diligent.
meaning: Hard work will eventually be rewarded.
author: Anonymous

pinyin: Bǎi wén bù rú yī jiàn.
english: Hearing a hundred times is not as good as seeing once.
meaning: Direct experience is more convincing than hearsay.
author: Anonymous
